activities.name: DB Floor Press
activities.description: Chest press performed lying on floor with dumbbells. Floor limits range of motion, protecting shoulders while building pressing strength.
tips: Pause briefly when triceps touch floor
Drive feet into ground for stability

activities.name: DB Squeeze Press
activities.description: Press dumbbells together throughout the movement, maximizing chest activation through constant tension.
tips: Focus on chest contraction, not weight

activities.name: DB Row
activities.description: Single-arm rowing motion targeting lats and upper back. Use bench or sturdy surface for support.
tips: Pull elbow toward hip, not shoulder
Keep back flat and core braced
Full stretch at bottom, squeeze at top

activities.name: DB Goblet Squat
activities.description: Squat holding dumbbell at chest. Excellent for learning squat mechanics and building quad/glute strength.

activities.name: DB Weighted Dead Bug
activities.description: Core anti-extension exercise. Hold dumbbell overhead while alternating opposite arm/leg extensions.
tips: Press lower back firmly into floor

activities.name: DB Bent-Over Row
activities.description: Bilateral rowing with both dumbbells, hinged at hips. Builds back thickness and hip hinge endurance.
tips: Hinge until torso is 45° or lower

activities.name: DB Pullover
activities.description: Lying on bench or floor, arc dumbbell from chest to overhead. Targets lats, serratus, and chest.
tips: Keep slight bend in elbows throughout
Feel stretch in lats at bottom

activities.name: DB Romanian Deadlift
activities.description: Hip hinge with dumbbells, targeting hamstrings and glutes. Key posterior chain builder.
tips: Push hips back, don't squat down
Feel hamstring stretch, then squeeze glutes to stand

activities.name: Pallof Press
activities.description: Anti-rotation core exercise using resistance band. Press band away from chest and resist rotation.
tips: Hold extended position, don't let band pull you

activities.name: DB Bulgarian Split Squat
activities.description: Single-leg squat with rear foot elevated. Excellent for leg strength, balance, and addressing imbalances.
tips: Control descent, drive through front heel

activities.name: DB Push Press
activities.description: Overhead press with leg drive. Use momentum from quarter-squat to press weight overhead.
tips: Dip and drive explosively with legs

activities.name: Band Face Pull
activities.description: Pull band toward face, externally rotating shoulders. Critical for shoulder health and posture.
tips: Pull to forehead level, not chin
Spread hands apart at end of pull

activities.name: DB Suitcase Hold
activities.description: Stand holding heavy dumbbell on one side, resisting lateral flexion. Core anti-lateral-flexion exercise.
tips: Stand tall, don't lean away from weight
Brace core and squeeze glute on weighted side

activities.name: DB Hip Thrust
activities.description: Glute-focused hip extension with upper back on bench. Primary glute builder.

activities.name: DB Incline Press
activities.description: Chest press at incline angle targeting upper chest. Use pillows or cushions to create incline on floor.

activities.name: DB Hammer Curl
activities.description: Bicep curl with neutral grip. Targets brachialis and brachioradialis in addition to biceps.
tips: Keep palms facing each other throughout

activities.name: DB Thruster
activities.description: Squat to overhead press in one fluid movement. Full-body power exercise.
tips: Use leg drive to initiate press
Lock out arms fully at top

activities.name: Renegade Row
activities.description: Row from plank position, alternating arms. Combines core stability with pulling strength.

activities.name: DB Farmer Carry
activities.description: Walk while holding heavy dumbbells at sides. Builds grip, core stability, and total body strength.

activities.name: DB Woodchop
activities.description: Diagonal chopping motion with dumbbell. Trains rotational power and core stability.
tips: Power comes from hips, not arms
Control the weight, don't let it swing you

activities.name: Rest
activities.description: Recovery period between activities or as a scheduled rest day.
